meanings.sent1: Before the storm arrived, the dark clouds presignaled its approach.
meanings.sent2: The traffic light presignaled the upcoming stop with a yellow glow.
meanings.sent3: The chirping birds presignaled the sunrise, waking everyone up.
meanings.sent4: The distant thunder presignaled the impending storm's arrival.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's raised hand presignaled the end of the lesson.

meanings.definition: A signal given in advance of a main signal
meanings.sent1: The bell ringing was a presignal for the students to change classes.
meanings.sent2: The flag raised on the ship served as a presignal for the upcoming arrival.
meanings.sent3: The smell of baking cookies was a delicious presignal of the upcoming treat.
meanings.sent4: The distant sound of drums acted as a presignal for the start of the ceremony.
meanings.sent5: The chirping of crickets was a presignal of the approaching night.

meanings.definition: To give a signal before an action or event
meanings.sent1: The referee presignaled the start of the race with a loud whistle.
meanings.sent2: The alarm clock presignaled the beginning of a new day.
meanings.sent3: The smell of popcorn presignaled the start of the movie.
meanings.sent4: The opening act presignaled the main performance of the night.
meanings.sent5: The first raindrops presignaled the coming storm.
